page.title: 07THE ATMOSPHERE OF SHELFORD
page.content: When we visited Shelford on a sunny Monday afternoon in June our first inpressions were that it is very well into the country which means it is quiet with no major roads or heavy traffic. It has no vandalism. there are lots of farms and cereal fields in Shelford but the farms have very few cattle so all the fields are used for crops.The farms are quite small and are fairly well spaced out.There are lots of trees around the churchyard.Most of the buildings are cottages or small houses.At the side of Shelford there is a river and you can easily see the river from Shelford. By Lizzie Preece and Jane Downs
